item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
You will be responsible for designing and implementing data models and ETL pipelines to meet product requirements, design of product functions, troubleshooting and resolving product defects, unit and integration testing. Active interaction with internal customers, other developers, Quality Assurance, Business System Analysts is an integral part of the role.

About the Role:

In the role of Sr. Data Engineer you will:

Participate in project/work planning sessions:

  • To analyze and understand requirements to the level of being able to contribute to their creation, in collaboration with capability/product and/or business owners.

  • Work in a hands-on data engineering role in a team-based cross-functional environment.

Develop and deliver:

  • Integrate applications per specification and translate technical requirements into application code and modules

  • Approach development work with a DevOps and continuous integration mindset.

  • Ensure consistency with cloud architectural guiding principles for assigned projects

  • Develop prototype or "proof of concept" implementations of projects where the technical solution is unknown or unproven

  • Proactive in raising problems, identifying solutions and giving/receiving feedback

  • Assist in identifying and correcting software performance bottlenecks

Be collaborative: Work in a highly collaborative and dynamic agile team environment with multiple levels of technology staff across various geographical locations

Coach and mentor: Providing technical expertise and peer code reviews to other team members and assist team leads and project managers in work break down and story planning

About You

You\'re a fit for Sr. Data Engineer if you have: 

  • Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent work experience.

  • 7+ years of experience in application development with demonstrable, proven expertise in design and development of high volume, high velocity data ingestion, complex data transformation using traditional ETL technologies or modern data ingestion/processing technologies.

  • Minimum 4 years of experience working with relational databases like Oracle, Postgres or similar using SQL. Should have hands on experience in writing performant queries/procedures handling complex functionalities. Experience in NoSQL databases and dealing with unstructured data will be good to have.

  • Hands on experience in developing data warehousing and big data analytics applications using big data frameworks like Hadoop, Spark and/or Flink and leveraging services such as AWS EMR or Google DataProc.

  • Strong understanding of concepts of ETL, ELT and data modeling.

  • Hands-on experience in development of cloud native applications in Google Cloud.

  • Hands-on experience in BigQuery / Google DataProc.

  • Exposure to reporting via looker would be an advantage.

  • Professional Google Cloud certification would be good to have.

  • Preferred familiarity with SQL-on-Hadoop technologies such as Spark SQL, Hive, and/or Presto.

  • Minimum 2 year of strong experience in python.

  • Programming experience in languages such as Java, C# etc.

  • Experience in orchestration tools like Apache Airflow.

  • Experience in troubleshooting performance issues resulted from high volume data during processing from upstream & serving to the downstream applications.

  • Prefer experience working with Linux or Unix based environments.

  • Other skills required:

  • Proven strong analytical design, problem solving and trouble-shooting skills.

  • Strong understanding of Cloud computing Technologies and related emerging technology.

  • Highly accountable for meeting all commitments and deadlines.

  • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal for technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Must be able to work independently as well as collaboratively.

  • Drive for continuous process improvement.

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one

  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks

  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? item.title: Data Governance Analyst
item.description:
The Data Governance Analyst role within the Commercial Data Office will be responsible for developing and implementing data standards, guaranteeing metadata is captured correctly, and creating methods for monitoring and reporting any data incidents. The Data Governance analyst will monitor applications to ensure they are complying to data governance procedures. They may also create and maintain common business glossaries for data and the tools or methods that support data standards for an organization.

About the Role:

  • Perform data profiling and database structure/model research in order to understand relevant data elements along with their definitions and use.
  • Participate in data governance policy and standard creation, management, and analyzing potential impacts of policy choices under consideration
  • Document and maintain data standards, partnering with functional and business data owners to map existing commercial data structures, usage, and common definitions
  • Design, build, and execute efficient and accurate control structures to assess data quality and compliance to data governance policy
  • Provide consultative support for commercial data clients, advising on policies, standards, and guidelines
  • Support the Data Governance team in establishing Working groups, as needed to drive consistency and decisioning
  • Support the Data Governance team in establishing and operating the company’s critical data forums (data councils, working groups, etc.)
  • Drive adoption of the company’s data governance focused policies

About You:

  • Bachelor’s degree required with 3+ years of experience
  • You are passionate about the benefits of accurate and actionable data, you drive consistency and enjoy partnering with others to accomplish the task
  • You are a solutions-oriented critical thinker
  • You have technical knowledge and experience in data management, data governance, and/or data quality
  • Comfortable leading team meetings and possess strong influencing and networking skills
  • You demonstrate the ability to translate business issues and requirements into actionable plans, and to deliver against those plans
  • You have the exceptional ability to make timely and effective decisions to meet fluid deadlines
  • You have the capability to work autonomously and make independent decisions to meet deliverables with minimal oversight
  • You are passionate about continuous improvement with a strong desire to continue learning in order to stay relevant to business changes and industry trends
  • You can effectively handle and maintain confidential information
  • You have at a minimum basic proficiency in SQL with a thorough understanding of data and systems\' infrastructures
  • Knowledge/experience in Alteryx preferred
  • Expert level Excel user
  • Proficient in BI tools such as Tableau

What\'s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology, LinkedIn learning
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that\'s effective day one
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks, 16 hours of paid volunteer time off yearly

item.title: Data Architect
item.description:
We are responsible for designing and delivering core technology platforms that provide tools for editorially enhancing and delivering content to our customers.  We are looking for a motivated and innovative Data Architect.  In this role, you will work across geographical boundaries with all levels of software engineers, technical management, and business partners.  You will set the data architectural direction for projects delivering new and re-engineered functionality.  The ideal candidate will have experience in making technology decisions on large, enterprise-scale software development programs. The candidate will also have extensive skills in the areas of design, development, mentoring and directing co-workers. 

About the Role 

In this opportunity as a Data Architect, you will: 

Design and deliver:

  • Creates the information architecture vision and strategy for the assets under the purview of the group
  • Defines the group’s governance and standards to deliver a cohesive information architecture for the organization
  • Delivers innovative and elegant information solutions that drive growth, and leverage to ensure faster time-to-market
  • Translates user requirements and business use cases to conceptual, logical, and physical data models and workflow processes.
  • Translates a business glossary into logical and physical data models, and coach/ supports data modelers and engineers in their development/ testing/ implementation effort.
  • Identify appropriate sources for external teams’ (R&D, Product Management, Editorial, Technology and other Content organizations) data needs, create the necessary data mapping and transformation rules, with a focus on business objectives and processes.
  • Ensures solutions meet the compliance and security needs of TR

Be Collaborative:

  • Communicates designs and solutions through formal and informal means to business unit executives, technology management, peers and development staff, and other colleagues

Coach and mentor:

  • Mentor junior staff in Data Modeling and other Information Architecture activities

Be curious and innovative:

  • Assists in the technology decisions for data strategy, workflow processes, and infrastructure for a wide range of system solutions for the Thomson Reuters Editorial and Content Operations teams.

About You 

You\'re a fit for the role of Data Architect if you have:  

  • 5+ years’ experience as a Data Modeler/ Data Architect, in an integrated business and IT collaborative environment.
  • Combination of strategic thinking and detail orientation.
  • Demonstrated ability to balance being inquisitive, curious, continuously learning, and realistic vs. visionary, technology savvy, and business orientation.
  • Excellent critical thinking, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to operate across organizational boundaries and to influence all stakeholders, (e.g., technology staff, business partners, and vendors) having an impact on the community.
  • Expert-level proficiency in data modeling for relational, dimensional, and big data platforms. Experience with a broad range of data schemas (e.g., ontologies, taxonomies, DTDs etc.), as well as strong SQL skills
  • Additional broad experience in enterprise use of the following technologies: Messaging Technologies (e.g., IBM MQ, Kafka), Big Data (Hadoop, HDFS, HBase, Spark), CSS, XML (DOM, SAX), DHTML/ XHTML/ HTML5, Web Services, Cognitive Computing, Classification, Machine Learning, NLP, NLG, Public Cloud (AWS & MS Azure), & MS Teams Foundation Server/Azure DevOps
  • Strong interpersonal skills supported by exceptional written and oral communication skills: strong hands-on documentation experience and collaboration skills working across geographical sites.
  • Experience with Agile software design methodologies and tools.

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:
    • On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology
    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams
    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks
  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance
  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries
  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

item.title: Associate Architect - Data Engineering
item.description:
Associate Architect

As a technologist at Thomson Reuters, you will help shape the global knowledge economy. Our technology ensures that professionals around the world have the answers they need. You will work with the brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results. As the world’s top provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. Bring your passion for innovation, and together we’ll make a difference.


About the Role 

In this role you will:

  • Be a Technical Leader – provide thought leadership and guidance in setting the architecture vision and direction for an extendible and maintainable set of editorial system and publishing capabilities. Work with technology teams and beyond to realize their implementation
  • Be a Team Player – ability to work in a collaborative and inclusive team-oriented environment, partner with cross functional and remote teams, draw out strong design ideas from diverse teams and high performing engineers, and translate requirements into actionable architecture
  • Be an Effective Communicator – ability to concisely and completely articulate complex technical issues; ability to target your audience, actively listen, and value diverse ideas
  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines
  • Be Curious & Innovative – ability to question the status quo.  Continuously update yourself with industry trends, next generation technology, and software development best practices. 

About You

  • Experience in software design, methodologies (especially Agile), and tools
  • Broad experience in enterprise-class system, full-stack, design and development including use of the following technologies: Java, Front-End Technologies (e.g., JavaScript, jQuery, Angular), XML (DOM, SAX), DHTML/XHTML/HTML5, CSS, Database and SQL (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server), as well as NoSQL, Messaging Technologies (e.g., IBM MQ, Kafka), APIs (e.g., REST, SOAP), Web Services (e.g, Tomcat), MS ADO, Eclipse, Ant, Maven, Junit
  • Must be an excellent communicator when speaking, writing, and in diagramming
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to operate across organizational boundaries and to influence business stakeholders, as well as technology peers
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to synthesize business requirements with technology capabilities to produce coherent technical designs
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and analyze new technologies
  • Have 5+years relevant experience in large distributed systems, including 1+ years architecture/ design experience.
  • You may also have:
    • Cloud experience (AWS or Azure)
    • Experience in Cognitive Computing (e.g, Machine Learning, NLP, Classification, Clustering)
    • Architecting API-first solutions
    • Experience in processing large volumes of data
    • System load and scale testing

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to cutting-edge technology
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks

item.title: VP, Data Management & Shared Services
item.description:
The strategic ambition of the newly created Thomson Reuters Data & Analytics (D&A) function is to build, embed and mature a data-driven culture across the entire company resulting in a world-class Data & Analytics company.

Position Description:
The VP, Data Management Shared Services is responsible for building, operating and evolving industry-leading data shared services across TR.  They will engage across all parts of the business to provide shared capabilities in data quality measurement, metadata, lineage, test data, and third-party data management domains. They are responsible for implementing cost effective services that deliver measurable value and year-on-year productivity improvements.

Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with all parts of TR to drive a data-driven culture
  • Design, implement, operate and evolve the teams, processes and tooling that provide shared data services across the company:
    • Master Data Management
    • Data Quality measurement
    • Metadata Management
    • Lineage Management
    • Test Data Management
    • 3rd Party Data Management
  • Implement self-service capabilities with automated controls
  • Actively track and report progress to senior stakeholders on progress and value delivered.
  • Responsible for setting the strategic direction and executing the roadmap for Master Data, Metadata, Lineage and Data Quality capabilities across all of TR
  • Implement training and certification programs for shared service teams and business partners.
  • Ensure D&A is a diverse and inclusive organisation.
  • Meet Financial Plan targets; drive productivity improvements (e.g. cost/unit reductions)

This role will partner across the TR Data & Analytics organization to:

  • Implement master data, data quality measurement, metadata tagging and lineage/provenance practices (with the Data & Model Governance team)
  • Set policies and standards related to data quality, metadata and lineage (with the Data & Model Governance team)
  • Deliver on Change Program capabilities

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, library sciences or equivalent experience
  • A minimum of 10 years of experience in data governance or data management operations
  • Prior experience working in a large, geographically dispersed organization.
  • Experience leading and developing highly effective teams
  • 10+ years of software development or process leadership and/or executive positions
  • Extensive experience creating and executing data management strategy and related technical roadmaps 
  • Ability to understand, evaluate and discuss technical integration scenarios and architectural concepts 
  • Experience with Agile methodologies and understanding of modern web/SaaS technologies and systems 
  • Experience presenting strategy and operational updates to senior executives 

Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience in driving large-scale change across a global organization
  • Strong organization, analytical and problem-solving skills with an end-user focus
  • Ability to prioritize, self-initiate, and create momentum, even with partial guidance or information
  • Exceptionally strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to effectively communicate updates and desired outcomes in a succinct manner

item.title: VP, Data Lake Platform
item.description:
The strategic ambition of the newly created Data & Analytics (D&A) function is to build, embed and mature a data-driven culture across the entire company resulting in a world-class Data & Analytics company.

Position Description:
The VP, Data Lake Platform is responsible for building, operating and evolving a single data lake in the cloud for Thomson Reuters.  They will engage with analytics teams across the company to ensure feature/function requirements are understood and prioritized to drive maximum value for customers and colleagues.  This leader will build a strong data engineering capability within TR and deliver DIY/Self-Serve capabilities to all certified analytics team members.

Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with all parts of TR to drive a data-driven culture
  • Design, implement, operate and evolve the TR Data Lake including:
    • Real-time, Near Real Time and Batch processing
    • Automated ingestion & data lineage controls
    • DIY/Self-service capabilities for certified lake consumers (e.g. DIY data pipelines, Data Publishing)
    • Automated data profiling and data quality measurement
    • Structured, Unstructured and Semi-structured data sources
  • Design and implement strong security and privacy enhancing technologies & methods.
  • Actively track and report progress to senior stakeholders on data lake progress and value enablement
  • Responsible for setting the strategic direction and executing the roadmap for TR Data Lake
  • Implement training and certification programs for Data Lake capabilities (pipelines, ingestion, conformance, etc)
  • Build a strong data engineering practice across TR
  • Ensure D&A is a diverse and inclusive organisation.
  • Meet Financial Plan targets; drive lake productivity improvements (e.g. cost/unit reductions)

This role will partner across the TR Data & Analytics organization to:

  • Implement data quality measurement, metadata tagging and lineage/provenance practices (with the D&A Data Management Shared Services team)
  • Automation of Data Stewardship and Model Governance function (with Data Governance and Advanced Analytics Platform teams)
  • Deliver on Change Program capabilities

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, library sciences or equivalent experience
  • A minimum of 10 years of experience in data warehouse or data lake platform construction and operations
  • Prior experience working in a large, geographically dispersed organization.
  • Experience leading and developing highly effective teams
  • 10+ years of software development or engineering and/or executive positions
  • Extensive experience creating and executing data platform strategy and related technical roadmaps 
  • Ability to understand, evaluate and decide among technical integration scenarios and architectural concepts 
  • Experience with Agile methodologies and understanding of modern web/SaaS technologies and systems 
  • Experience presenting strategy and operational updates to senior executives 

Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience in driving large-scale change across a global organization
  • Strong organization, analytical and problem-solving skills with an end-user focus
  • Ability to prioritize, self-initiate, and create momentum, even with partial guidance or information
  • Exceptionally strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to effectively communicate updates and desired outcomes in a succinct manner

item.title: Enterprise Data and Analytics Architect
item.description:
Enterprise Data and Analytics Architect, Technology

As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. 

Thomson Reuters is currently implementing a large digital transformation programme, to fundamentally transform our Lead to Support processes and enable Digital. Data plays a critical role in digital transformation and this role play a pivotal role in defining the data and analytics technology strategy, developing the relevant architectures and governing the solutions end to end.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Enterprise Data and Analytics Architect, Technology you will: 

  • Be a People Leader: build and manage a team of data architects with varied skills and experience level. Coach and mentor current and future leaders within the team, be responsible to proactively identify individual training needs, conduct performance reviews and maintain a healthy team culture
  • Be a Project Leader: train/coach team members in project delivery. Strategically plan, design and implement software to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Be an Architecture Leader: implement best practices as knowledge expert in Information Architecture, data modeling, data lake, data warehousing and data analytics using best of the technologies, working in an agile framework and an advocate for agility within the team and with stakeholders. Ability to define and influence data and analytics strategy, be part of the development of architecture, and be able to govern the overall data portfolio
  • Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager: collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management in defining roadmap for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues
  • Be a Decision Maker: make quick and effective data driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills to infer qualitative and quantitative data, and roll out strategy that aligns with company goals
  • Be Responsible for:
    • Architecture Strategy & Roadmap - define and update architecture strategy for Data and Analytics roadmap
    • Architecture design for enterprise data models, taxonomy, data quality, data lake and data warehouse and analytics capabilities
    • Architecture Governance – run and co-chair the architecture review boards and design authorities

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Enterprise Data and Analytics Architect, Technology if you:

Have deep understanding and expert skills in:

  • Expertise in driving data and analytics strategy and execution, while establishing strategic partnerships and delivering against business requirements
  • Development of the data services & platforms in support of self-service, that ensures TR can both facilitate and catalyze the adoption of these services in the most effective way
  • Identify, propose and implement solutions where the data & analytics architecture can be utilized to achieve a competitive edge, adding value to the business and practice, with measurable payback.
  • Architecture governance and design authority to ensure solutions are in line with the overall data and analytics strategy
  • Data & Analytics architecture development for projects & programs
  • Data modelling 3NF & Dimensional, including conceptual, logical and physical
  • Development & maintenance of the Enterprise Data Model
  • Data Warehousing, including data models and data processing
  • Unstructured information analysis
  • Information taxonomy creation
  • Master and Reference data management
  • Data analytics architecture strategy and development
  • Experience with modern saas, data and analytics technologies (Exadata, Snowflake, Tableau, Salesforce, Adobe, SAP HANA, Informatica, Dell Boomi, OBIEE etc)
  • Have a bachelor\'s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering or related technical field is preferred
  • An effective communicator with relevant experience leading and influencing others, demonstrating an ability to partner effectively with internal and external partners.
  • Experience of working in global matrix team environments with global time zones
  • TOGAF architecture certification

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

Learning & Development: Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology 

  • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams
  • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc. 
  • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

Benefits/Perks:   

  • Health benefits 
  • Savings/investment plans 
  • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave) 

Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance 

Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries 

Your wellbeing:  We offer programs that focus on making our lives healthier

Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. item.title: Senior Database Engineer
item.description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. 

As a Senior Database Engineer working with the latest technologies, Microsoft Azure has to offer you will be working with a global team of engineers to improve product and service delivery

About the Role

As a Sr. Database Engineer, you will: 

  • Build and Develop – Work practices and methods to ensure they are the best for the task allocated

  • Be a Team Player – work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams

  • Be Curious & Innovative – continuously update yourself with next generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices

  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – responsible for performance, reliability and implement changes for improving the efficiency of a technical component

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Sr. Database Engineer if you have:

  • 8 – 10 years of work experience in MS SQL & 4 – 5 years in Azure SQL database administration capacity.

  • Experience managing systems and databases hosted in the cloud (Azure/AWS), understanding of design patterns for scalability, performance and reliability.

  • Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies

  • Experience supporting 24/7 multi-tenant systems preferably for a SaaS application.

  • Working knowledge of database table partitioning techniques and processes.

  • Hands-on experience building and maintaining SQL Transactional Replication topologies

  • Exposure to SSIS and ETL processes

  • Strong understanding of database encryption technologies, database structures, principles and best practices.

  • Strong working experience with SQL Server

  • Experience working with cross functional and remote teams

  • Self-driven and resourceful to achieve goals independently as well as work well in groups

  • Experience with test-driven development and automated testing frameworks

  • Eager to learn and willing to take initiatives

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience  

  • Interest or experience coaching junior and mid-level engineers

  • Strong DevOps focus, and working experience knowledge with technologies like Azure native database and ETL technologies.

  • Clear understanding of ITIL and ITSM

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

item.title: Senior Applied Research Scientist - NLP
item.description:
Are you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Toronto and Minneapolis is seeking scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art Information Retrieval, Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research and the development of new products and technologies. TR Labs innovates collaboratively across our core segments in Legal, Tax & Accounting, Government, and Reuters News. We undertake a diverse portfolio of projects today while investing in long-term research for the future.

As a scientist in Labs, you will be part of a global interdisciplinary team of experts. We hire specialists across a variety of AI research areas, as well as Engineering and Design, to drive the company\'s digital transformation. TR Labs is known for consistently delivering projects that advance the state of the art in support of high-growth products and serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways.

More about Thomson Reuters Labs - http://tr.com/ai-jobs

About the role

In this opportunity as an Applied Research Scientist, you will:

  • Experiment and Develop: You will execute the entire model development lifecycle, building, testing and delivering high-quality solutions. You will apply best practices to conduct reproducible research and well-managed software delivery.

  • Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe.

  • Delivery: You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables.

  • Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies.

  • Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.

About you

You are a fit for the role of an Applied Research Scientist if you have:

  • Ph.D. in a relevant discipline or Master\'s plus a comparable level of experience

  • At least 5+ years of experience building IR/NLP/ML systems 

  • Solid software engineering skills for prototyping

  • Experience as a technical leader, coordinating and guiding the work of others 

Preferred qualifications

  • 8+ years of academic or industry experience building IR or NLP systems with the demonstrated ability to translate cutting edge research into working applications

  • Demonstrated ability to translate customer needs into well-structured research/project plans 

  • Proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala and experience delivering minimum viable products in a large enterprise environment

  • Outstanding communication, organization, and data-driven decision making 

  • Publications at relevant venues such as ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, KDD or similar

What\'s in it for you

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology

  • Our Scientists and Engineers get to play with big data sets to discover new products, capabilities, and insights for our customers. Thomson Reuters is most well-known for the globally respected Reuters News agency, but our company is also the leading source of information for legal, corporate and tax professionals. We have over 60,000 TBs worth of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data.

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage effective day one, savings and investment plans

  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs

  • Social Impact: Paid time off for volunteering virtually or in your community

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Python/Java
item.description:
Thomson Reuters Labs works across all business segments of Thomson Reuters. You will be part of a diverse, agile, and interdisciplinary innovation team located in Toronto - collaborating with colleagues located in the United States of America, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and India. You will work closely with other engineers, designers, data scientists, and stakeholders to build solutions that use data analysis and AI, like machine learning (ML). The science and engineering of AI are rapidly evolving. We are looking for an adaptable learner who can think in code and likes to learn and develop new skills as they are needed; someone comfortable with jumping into new problem spaces; who is comfortable with ambiguity and pivoting when needed. Is this you? Come join us!

What do we do? In Thomson Reuters Labs, we experiment, build and deliver. We work with big data sets to discover what new products, services, or insights we can create for our customers. We then work across the organization to build and deliver these capabilities. Thomson Reuters is perhaps most well-known for the Reuters News agency. The company is also one of the top sources of information for legal professionals, corporations, and tax professionals. We have over 60,000 TBs of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data.

Do you love creating innovative solutions for customers? We are seeking a passionate Senior Software Engineer proficient in either Python or Java with practical experience delivering machine learning (ML) models in cloud environments – such as Amazon Web Services. As a member of Thomson Reuters Labs in Toronto, you will have a direct impact on our company by helping to create new and innovative capabilities that will delight our customers.

About the Role

In this opportunity as a Senior Software Engineer - Python/Java, you will: 

  • Develop and Deliver: Applying modern software development practices, you will be involved in the entire software development lifecycle, building, testing, and delivering high-quality solutions.

  • Solve Complex Problems: You will create large-scale data processing pipelines to help researchers build and train novel machine learning algorithms. You will develop high-performing scalable systems in the context of large online delivery environments.

  • Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams.

  • Be an Agile Person:  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines.

  • Be Innovative: You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries.

  • Be an Effective Communicator: Through dynamic engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments.

About You

You\'re a fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer - Python/Java if you have: 

Preferred qualifications: 

  • 4+ years experience in software development using Python or Java software development stacks and ecosystems

  • Hands-on experience building cloud-native applications in AWS or Azure (preferably Azure)

  • Proficiency in system analysis and design and can “think in code”

  • Experience working in an agile environment

Basic qualifications: 

  • Bachelor of Science degree or equivalent in computer science or related field with 4+ years of professional software development experience 

  • Desire to work with Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP)

  • Curiosity and comfortable with rapid change and learning new things 

  • Desire to positively impact the world around them and someone who isn\'t afraid to dive right in, is comfortable working at a fast pace, embraces change, and can creatively pivot when needed

What\'s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to cutting-edge technology

  • Our scientists and engineers explore big data sets to discover new capabilities and insights

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that\'s effective day one

  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks

item.title: Solution Architect - Marketing
item.description:
Solution Architect – Marketing

Do you want to help one of the most respected companies in the world reinvent its approach to Marketing Technology? Are you a strategic thinker with a strong background in solution architecture?  We are looking for you to join our team as a Solution Architect – Marketing. We are recruiting a team of motivated technology professionals to transform how we manage and leverage technology solutions to enable our go to market strategies. This is a unique opportunity for you to join a diverse and global team with centers of excellence in Toronto, Minneapolis and Dallas.

As a Marketing Solution Architect you will be responsible for the conceptual and logical solution architecture of the Marketing technology ecosystem. You will also collaborate with key stakeholders to define the marketing technology architecture roadmap and support the selection and implementation of technologies, including tooling, integration patterns and data interoperability to allow us to seamlessly operate world class marketing.

About the Role

In this opportunity as a Marketing Solution Architect, you will: 

Design: Understanding business strategy and supporting processes to drive the right architecture, leading to an integrated systems architecture

Recommend new or different technologies that will not only meet project requirements, but also align to business objectives, roadmaps and strategic solutions, as well as to TR’s architecture principles and standards

Deliver: Clear architecture documents, including architecture patterns, decisions, and rationale for those decisions

Mentor/Lead: Act as counselor to business counterparts, customers, and management on requirements and capabilities pertinent to Marketing Technology

Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams

Be an Agile Person:  with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines

item.title: Lead, Machine Learning Software Engineer
item.description:
Come and join the Global Digital Technology team at one of the most respected companies globally, as we work to transform Thomson Reuters into a truly Digital company. We aren\'t just changing how customers engage with us but also transforming and re-imagining our business by focusing on the individual user. We are looking for an experienced Lead Software Engineer with experience in Machine Learning techniques and building data-driven capabilities that drive personalized digital customer experiences. Our team promotes an agile, collaborative, supportive environment where diverse thinking, innovative design and experimentation are welcomed and encouraged. Our work focuses on an extensive portfolio of transformational efforts as we work together to deliver on the promise of making it easy to do business with Thomson Reuters.

About The Role

In this opportunity, you will:

  • Develop, Deliver & Lead: build and deliver ML models that power personalized digital experiences and customized Thomson Reuters\' web content, product bundling, services offering, as well as add-ons. 

  • Be a Team Player: Working in a diverse and collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams. This role will partner closely with the digital front and back-end engineering teams and the digital product management function to deliver seamless and intuitive digital solutions to our global customers.

  • Be an Agile Person:  with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver innovative solutions using modern technologies. 

  • Be Innovative: you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute creative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries. 

  • Be an Effective Communicator: through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments. 

About You 

You\'re a fit for the role if you have: 

  • 7+ years of experience building ML systems with the demonstrated ability to translate cutting edge research into working applications

  • A solid understanding of the SDLC and hands-on experience in one or more programming and scripting languages (Python, Java, TypeScript, JavaScript, etc.) as well as familiarity with SQL

  • A solid understanding of concepts in machine learning and statistics, including recommendation models

  • Ability to understand, apply, integrate and deploy Machine Learning capabilities and techniques into other systems. 

  • Familiarity with the Python data science stack through exposure to libraries such as Numpy, Scipy, Pandas, Dask, spaCy, NLTK, sci-kit learn. 

  • Experience writing clean, reusable, maintainable and well-tested code.

  • Demonstrated proficiency in automation, system monitoring, and cloud-native applications, with familiarity in AWS or Azure (or a related cloud platform) 

  • A desire to learn and embrace new and emerging technology 

  • A Bachelor\'s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering or related technical field. 

We\'d also strongly value if you: 

  • Had previous exposure to commercial recommendation (or following best action) engines based on propensity models

  • Can understand and translate between language and methodologies used both in research and engineering fields 

  • Have been successfully taking and integrating Machine Learning solutions to production-grade software

What\'s in it for you  

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth: 

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology 

  • Our Scientists and Engineers get to play with big data sets to discover new products, capabilities, and insights for our customers. Thomson Reuters is most well-known for the globally respected Reuters News agency, but our company is also the leading source of information for legal, corporate and tax professionals. We have over 60,000 TBs worth of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data.  

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage effective day one, savings and investment plans 

  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs 

  • Social Impact: Paid time off for volunteering virtually or in your community

item.title: Sr. User Experience Researcher
item.description:
Sr. User Experience Researcher
Thomson Reuters is looking for a Senior User Experience Researcher to help deliver a user experience that is intuitive, comfortable, and that will develop trust for this state-of-the-art technology. As a Senior UX Researcher, you will define and execute on user research programs, spanning a broad set of experiences and modalities. Research activities will predominantly be discovery to develop a deeper understanding of users that will inform an intuitive and satisfying product design, along with some evaluative work (usability studies and concept evaluation).

Your UX research will be essential in our ongoing effort to better enable product and design teams to make informed, confident decisions. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity.
 

About the Role:

In this role as Sr. User Experience Researcher, you will

  • Determine and recommend the most efficient and effective user-centered research approaches (qualitative and quantitative) to solve for business needs, meet agreed-upon objectives, and guide business areas through the appropriate UX process.
  • Lead foundational research activities that explore the problem space, frame the problems to be solved, and gather enough evidence and initial direction to define what to do next.
  • Lead discovery research activities to inform UX design decisions.
  • Monitor UX project execution, including establishing and tracking UX project metrics and UX product scorecards.
  • Develop user journeys and personas.
  • Synthesize quantitative data with qualitative data to help drive product and design decisions.
  • Work collaboratively with user experience team members, content writers, development teams, product teams, users, and other stakeholders as part of an agile software development process.
  • Support, partner and influence multi-disciplinary teams, including other business areas, to execute UX projects.
  • Take ownership for self-development, stay current with research techniques and tools in the field of UX.
  • Be a self-starter. Take initiatives and drive projects from beginning to end.
  • Mentor and assist UX Researchers as needed.

About You:

You are a fit for the role of Sr. User Experience Researcher, If you have:

  • Master’s degree or higher in a field such as Cognitive Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, User Experience, Human Factors, Engineering Psychology, Interactive Design, or equivalent.
  • 5+ years of UX research experience or 8+ years of experience in lieu of degree.
  • Experience in UX research on B2B SaaS solutions.
  • Experience in foundational/generative and qualitative research to identify needs/problems and workflow/task analysis.
  • Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research throughout an Agile development process.
  • Experience with using data analytics to identify UX research course of action a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Comfortable with planning, prioritizing, conducting, analyzing and communicating research in a variety of contexts.
  • A dedicated advocate of a user-centered, evidence-based approach to product development, while balancing business needs.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders, customers, and team members.

This position can be located in Toronto, London, Zug, Minneapolis, Dallas

 

What’s in it For You:

At Thomson Reuters, people are our greatest assets & in this role you will be part of Thomson Reuters Product Organisation which is comprised of the most experienced personnel in the industry & supported by Executive Management team. There are exciting changes happening in UX Research team at Thomson Reuters and our team is growing! We are looking for a senior-level researcher to join our team at Thomson Reuters to assist in improving the experience of our software and discovering new opportunities for innovation in product development. As a Senior UX Researcher , you will be working within a cross-functional team, defining and executing on user research programs, spanning a broad set of experiences and modalities. Research activities will predominantly be discovery to develop a deeper understanding of users that will inform an intuitive and satisfying product design, along with some evaluative work (usability studies and concept evaluation). Experience in generative research, storytelling and presentation skills are a must.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Thomson Reuters Indirect Tax Group is responsible for a suite of highly available, mission-critical products, which enable our large scale global customers to compute tax for every transaction that flows through their systems worldwide. The transactions ranged from online transactions generated from travel sites, e-commerce sites; transactions at points of sale for retail customers; transactions between participating businesses across 190 countries worldwide.

Are you passionate about building large, scalable, highly available, 24 / 7 mission-critical systems deployed in the cloud? If so, join us at our Toronto Technology Centre, and help shape the product\'s future and take it to new heights.

About the Role 

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will: 

  • Build and Develop – 

    • Software applications by understanding user needs, functional and non-functional requirements; writing well designed, performant, testable and extensible code, employing the most appropriate design patterns, data structures, algorithms; ensuring adherence to all aspects of SDLC including static code analysis, testing, security scans, all the way through deployment into production

    • Software applications with a constant /continuous focus on cross-cutting concerns like but not limited to reliability, resilience, scalability, performance, security and alignment with the big picture of the overall application

    • Troubleshoot and debug issues and production incidents

  • Be a Team Player – 

    • Work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams

    • Mentoring junior engineers, helping them understand the product and encouraging them to adopt and apply best practices of design and development

    • Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback

  • Be Curious & Innovative – 

    • Continuously update yourself with next-generation technology, development tools, and apply the same towards improvement in the product and development practices

  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines.

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – responsible for performance, reliability and implement changes for improving the efficiency of a technical component. 

About You

You\'re a fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer if you have: 

Basic qualifications:

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals in Data Structures and algorithm design. Strong understanding of time and space complexity.

  • Hands-on experience coding in OOP (JAVA, Springboot, spring framework), software engineering and development process  

  • Experience with relational database systems, e.g. Oracle, PostgreSQL and ORM tools like Hibernate and JPA framework.

  • Experience working with cloud-native applications (AWS), understanding design patterns for scalability, performance and reliability.

  • Experience building API services using: REST, SOAP, deployed in a distributed environment, and a good understanding of related concepts like distributed caching, strong and eventual

  • Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies to deliver high-end applications against strict timelines have a strong understanding of agile principles.

  • Experience working with cross-functional and remote teams

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in computer science or equivalent experience   

  • Strong DevOps focus and experience with technologies like Docker, Chef, Kubernetes etc.

What\'s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: 

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - the ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks: 

    • Health benefits

item.title: Cloud Security Associate Architect
item.description:
Essential Responsibilities:

  • Maintain a deep understanding of core public cloud security disciplines, with close attention to developing industry trends in the context of networking, identity, and platform security technologies
  • Serve as the Cloud Security Lead in the design, implementation, and integration phases of business products and services to meet business security requirements, address corporate risks and exposures in cloud-based solutions
  • Maintain a deep understanding of capabilities and patterns to controlling access to the public cloud through authentication, authorization, access policy, and secrets management
  • Collaborate with business and technology peers to understand business goals, use cases for cloud-native deployments or lift-and-shift
  • Thoroughly interact with DevOps, platform engineering team, Network security engineers, and Identity build and run teams. Should be able to guide the teams to drive results and maturity
  • Perform threat modeling on the cloud-based scenarios and able to apply the principles to secure the cloud platforms
  • Drive security design principles and requirements to enhance ISRMs ability to streamline the implementation of security controls into new and existing solutions
  • Should be able to enforce the security principles in live scenarios by working closing with landing zone teams
  • Serve as a cloud security subject matter expert during discussions and meetings with key stakeholders within the business unit and infrastructure teams
  • Interact with peers, project teams, technical specialists, and other senior members of the company to provide advice on cloud security and identity-related security. Provide technical security expertise, including communicating security architectural decisions, benefits, risks, and other activities including security requirement definition, and facilitation of security testing and management of residual risk with the product or application teams
  • Develop and maintain security frameworks, consisting of appropriate controls from NIST CSF, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, and other relevant industry documentation

Key Relationships: (Those key individuals they will work with internally and externally)

Cloud Architects, Datacenter Architects, Business Unit Architects and Back Office Architects

Essential Skills/Experience Required: (Outline in bullet point form the absolute must-have skills & experience)

Qualifications/Requirements 

5+ Years experience in a security-related domain and technologies

3+ Years experience in security architecture space

2+ Years of Hands-On experience in the cloud security platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google (preferably engineering)

Working and hands-on knowledge of:

  • Hands-on capability on Cloud platforms and migrating workloads from Data Center to Cloud Platforms
  • Should be conversant with most of the Cloud Platform Security domains
  • Should have good knowledge of security containers and hands-on experience on SecDevOps principles and has a good handle on end-to-end Sec Dev Ops processes.
  • Good understanding of Key Management, Secrets Handling, knowledge on the tools which provide services like Single Sign-On, MFA, enabling data security principles in the cloud platforms. etc
  • Technology and hands-on exposure to Active Directory, Palo Alto Prisma, Advanced firewalls, virtual directory services, etc  

About You

Education/ Certifications: (Specific degrees and/or certifications (denote required or preferred))

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field required
  • Certification like AWS Security Specialty, Google Cloud Platform Engineer with focus on security, Azure Security, etc are preferred  
  • Technical understanding of cloud-native architecture and engineering best practices
  • CISSP or equivalent  certification are preferred

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Cloud
item.description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career.

Thomson Reuters is seeking a passionate, hardworking, and enthusiastic Senior Software Engineer - Cloud to be part of our highly dynamic engineering team responsible for the development and modernization of our ONESOURCE Global Trade application suite. ONESOURCE Global Trade is a comprehensive trade automation solution designed to help multinational corporations increase efficiency, reduce costs, manage risk, and seamlessly meet import/export compliance regulations around the world.

About the Role

As a Senior Software Engineer - Cloud, you will: 

  • Develop and modernize – software applications using best practices in coordination with a distributed team

  • Be a Team Player and contributor – work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams; contribute to design choices where necessary

  • Be Curious & Innovative – have an advanced understanding of software development methodologies and the demonstrated ability to design and develop complex software systems; leverage “innovation time” to work on pet projects and special areas of interest; comfortable with ambiguity, and even use it to drive better ideas, work and success

  • Be an Agile Person – contribute to all aspects of an agile software development process including design, programming, testing, documentation, quality assurance, and implementation

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – lead code reviews to enforce code standards and provide constructive feedback to developers; strong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills

  • Be a Leader – mentor the technical resources on the team to reinforce best practice and develop the team members

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer - Cloud if you have:

Basic qualifications:

  • 5 to 7 years of experience developing cloud-native applications:

    • Full-stack development

      • C# / .Net Core

      • TypeScript

      • Angular

      • API’s – REST / GraphQL

      • Microservices

      • MVC

    • Database – SQL / NoSQL

    • AWS - Serverless / Lambda

    • Containers - Docker, ECS/EKS, and Kubernetes

    • Message Queueing Services – Amazon SQS / MQ

    • DevOps - CI/CD practices and tools and understanding of pipelines

  • Experience with Domain-Driven Design (DDD) software development practices

  • Understanding of design patterns and N-Tier architecture

  • SaaS-based software development experience on large to enterprise-class applications

  • Have a seasoned background in cloud software development on AWS or Azure

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience  

  • Understand algorithms and data structure and how to efficiently implement them into a solution

  • Ability to translate business requirements into analytics solutions and create visualizations levering data modeling tools

  • Have a vision for product modernization through innovation and cutting-edge technology

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor , and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks: 

    • Health benefits

    • Savings/investment plans

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

  • Be Curious & Innovative – have an advanced understanding of software development methodologies and the demonstrated ability to design and develop complex software systems; leverage “innovation time” to work on pet projects and special areas of interest; comfortable with ambiguity, and even use it to drive better ideas, work and success

  • Be an Agile Person – contribute to all aspects of an agile software development process including design, programming, testing, documentation, quality assurance, and implementation

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – lead code reviews to enforce code standards and provide constructive feedback to developers; strong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills

  • Be a Leader – mentor the technical resources on the team to reinforce best practice and develop the team members

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer if you have:

Basic qualifications:

  • 5 to 7 years of experience developing cloud-native applications using C#, .NET core, MVC, Microservices, API\'s, Angular, Typescript and Databases

  • Experience with AWS - Serverless / Lambda, Containers - Docker, ECS/EKS & Kubernetes, Message Queueing Services – Amazon SQS / MQ

  • SaaS-based software development experience on large to enterprise-class applications

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience  

  • Understand algorithms and data structure and how to efficiently implement them into a solution

  • Ability to translate business requirements into analytics solutions and create visualizations levering data modeling tools

  • Have a vision for product modernization through innovation and cutting-edge technology

  • Experience with Domain-Driven Design (DDD) software development practices

  • Understanding of design patterns and N-Tier architecture

  • Understanding of DevOps - CI/CD pipeline and tools

item.title: Enterprise Architect, O2C and Finance
item.description:
Enterprise Architect – Order to Cash and Finance, Technology

As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. 

Thomson Reuters is currently implementing a large digital transformation programme, to fundamentally transform our Lead to Support processes and enable Digital. Order to Cash and Finance plays a critical role in digital transformation and this role play a pivotal role in defining the Order to Cash and Finance technology strategy & roadmap, developing the relevant architectures and governing the solutions end to end.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Enterprise Architect – Order to Cash and Finance, Technology you will: 

  • Be a People Leader: build and manage a team of solution architects with varied skills and experience level. Coach and mentor current and future leaders within the team, be responsible to proactively identify individual training needs, conduct performance reviews and maintain a healthy team culture
  • Be a Project Leader: train/coach team members in project delivery. Strategically plan, design and implement software to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Be an Architecture Leader: Acting as the go to individual for technology and architecture decisions within the Global Order to Cash and Finance organisation and ensuring these decisions are based on commercial and technical factors, are aligned with TR’s strategic direction and are compatible with the wider Enterprise Architecture
  • Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager: collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management in defining roadmap for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues
  • Be a Decision Maker: make quick and effective data driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills to infer qualitative and quantitative data, and roll out strategy that aligns with company goals
  • Be Responsible for:
    • Architecture Strategy & Roadmap - define and update architecture strategy for Order to Cash and Finance roadmap, keeping abreast with current and emerging technology trends within the domain. Responsible for the delivery of architecture artefacts including target and transition architectures and roadmaps
    • Architecture design for enterprise processes, integrations and applications to support the Order to Cash and Finance vision and objectives.
    • Architecture Governance – run and co-chair the architecture review boards and design authorities

About You

Essential Experience, Skills And Knowledge

  • Experience working in a large global organisation as a senior architect, ideally with a heavy Digital architecture focus
  • Delivered Enterprise or Solution Architecture across multiple technology and application domains solving complex business issues
  • Led global teams of architects, both directly and indirectly via a matrix approach
  • Managed stakeholders at all levels in an organisation, including to ‘C-Level’

Technical / Functional / Leadership Skills Required

  • An excellent knowledge of current and emerging B2B/B2B2C/B2C Order to Cash and Finance models and technologies including SAP S/4HANA, SAP BRIM, SAP ERP, SAP Finance, Collections and Payment architectures including High Radius, Paymetric, Customer 360 etc
  • Have expertise in driving Global Order to Cash and Finance strategy and execution, while establishing strategic partnerships and delivering against business requirements
  • Experience in Convergent Billing, Invoicing, Charging and other billing models such as Usage
  • Experience in implementing Subscription and transaction-based business models
  • Experience in implementing Finance Transformations programs including Central Finance consolidation
  • Enterprise Architecture including good knowledge of TOGAF and strong skills in architecture modelling techniques like business and technology capability modelling, maturity modelling, change readiness assessments, impact assessments etc.
  • Experience in creating Conceptual, Logical and Physical architecture views and communicating them to respective audiences
  • Lead Solution Architecture on major programmes
  • Architecture governance and design authority to ensure solutions are in line with the overall data and analytics strategy
  • An effective communicator with relevant experience leading and influencing others, demonstrating an ability to partner effectively with internal and external partners.
  • TOGAF architecture certification
  • Business acumen, ability to articulate both business, commercial and technical ideas clearly and simply
  • Consulting skills to engage, communicate with and influence stakeholders effectively
  • Commercial skills (understand and consider financial implications of proposals)
  • Effective communication, engagement, and relationship management skills
  • Effective facilitation, influencing and negotiation skills
  • Have a bachelor\'s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering or related technical field is preferred

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology 
  • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

  • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance 
  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries
